page.title: 01A SECTION OF EAST LOTHIAN
page.content: OUR SECTION OF EAST LOTHIAN,SCOTLAND IS MOSTLY COUNTRYSIDE.AS YOU LEAVE EDINBURGH YOU SEE MORE GRASS AND FIELDS.IT IS QUITE A CONTRAST TO THE BUSY STREETS AND SHOPS.THE VIEW STRETCHES FOR MILES AND MILES ACROSS THE RIVER FORTH.YOU CAN SEE COCKENZIE POWER STATION AND THE FORTH ROAD/RAIL BRIDGES. ELPHINSTONE VILLAGE IS VERY SMALL.IT HAS A POPULATION OF ROUGHLY 623 .THERE ARE TWO MAIN SHOPS ,ONE PHONE BOX AND ONE SCHOOL.THE HOUSES AND GARDENS ARE VERY NEAT AND ONLY ONE BUILDING IS VANDALISED.WALLYFORD,PART OF WHICH IS IN OUR AREA, IS SLIGHTLY BIGGER. THE FARMS IN THE AREA ARE MAINLY ARABLE.THERE ARE ALSO SOME CATTLE.PEOPLE IN THE AREA ARE EMPLOYED ON THE FARMS,AT CARBERRY CANDLES AND ON WALLYFORD INDUSTRIAL ESTATE.OTHER INHABITANTS COMMUTE TO LARGER TOWNS NEARBY.
